intro: Capsella cochlearina, commonly known as the mouse-ear cress, is a small flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in clusters, blooming from spring to early summer. Capsella cochlearina is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an annual or biennial plant.
